author: IGN
description:
Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition reviewed by George Yang on Nintendo Switch.

Xenoblade Chronicles X was already one of the Wii U’s best games, and this Definitive Edition has escaped the destruction of its old home like the White Whale and settled down nicely on Switch. The quality-of-life improvements here are enough to justify another trip to Mira alone for veteran players, and it’s the perfect opportunity for newcomers to explore its beautiful landscapes for themselves. Its combat systems are deep and engaging, and the massive open world never got old to run, jump or fly across. Its main story may not quite live up to the standards of the series, but a likable cast of characters and plenty of compelling side missions mean Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition is still an adventure worth writing back home about.
title: Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition Review

author: IGN
description:
FragPunk reviewed by Justin Koreis on PC, also available on Xbox Series X|S.

In the heat of the action, FragPunk feels great. The hilariously mad Shard Cards make every round distinct, and with so many potential combinations, it is hard to imagine its signature game mode growing tiresome any time soon. It’s just a shame that the economy and reward systems built around it are such a mess, and the unlockables that you are supposed to work towards aren’t very interesting. It’s still exciting to play, especially when all eyes fall on you in a match-ending Duel – but when the thrill of victory alone loses its luster, there isn’t a compelling reason to stick around for the long haul unless what you earn and how you earn it changes significantly.

#IGN #Gaming
title: FragPunk Review

author: IGN
description:
In today's Daily Fix:
The second half of this month's Game Pass games has been revealed, and the highly anticipated survival RPG Atomfall leads the charge. Subscribers are also getting the JRPG Octopath Traveller 2, co-op roguelike 33 Immortals, adventure game Mythwrecked: Ambrosia, and more. In entertainment news, the God of War live-action series has been greenlit for a second season by Amazon, but they haven't even announced the release date for Season 1 yet. And finally, Helldivers 2 gets a new patch and a new warbond, this one with a space cowboy theme. Also expect that new patch to make fighting the Automotons a little harder.
title: Atomfall, 33 Immortals, More Coming to Xbox Game Pass Wave 2 For March 2025 - IGN Daily Fix

author: IGN
description:
Chasmal Fear will be available on Steam on April 17, 2025. Watch the Chasmal Fear trailer for this underwater FPS action horror game, featuring bodycam-style visuals. The Chasmal Fear trailer shows gameplay, co-op mode, and terrifying creatures you'll fight. 

In Chasmal Fear, players find themselves trapped in the depths of Magnus Underwater City, a once-thriving sci-fi facility that’s now eerily abandoned, its halls crawling with unspeakable horrors. With limited ammo and supplies, every encounter is a high-stakes decision: stand your ground and fight, or slip through the shadows and avoid what lurks in the dark. Survival isn’t the only goal, secrets lie hidden in the abyss, and only by piecing together clues, solving puzzles, and uncovering lost areas can players unravel the mystery of what really happened here.

#IGN #Gaming
title: Chasmal Fear - Official Release Date Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Get a deep dive into the story setup and behind-the-scenes look at Assassin's Creed Shadows in this video for the upcoming action RPG. Join members of the development team as they discuss the story setting, the differences between the main characters, film influences and techniques that went into creating the game, and more. Assassin's Creed Shadows will be available on PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X|S, macOS, Amazon Luna, and PC (Steam) on March 20, 2025.

In Assassin’s Creed Shadows, you will live the intertwined stories of Naoe, an adept shinobi Assassin from Iga Province, and Yasuke, the powerful African samurai of historical legend. Against the backdrop of the turbulent late Sengoku period, this remarkable duo will discover their common destiny as they usher in a new era for Japan.
title: Assassin's Creed Shadows - Official Setting the Scene Overview

author: IGN
description:
Assassin’s Creed Shadows reviewed by Jarrett Green on PC and PlayStation 5. Also available on Xbox Series X/S.

Assassin’s Creed Shadows takes a flashing blade to the series’ established norms, trimming them to a more precise form in lieu of chopping them down outright. Combat is aggressive and requires more intentional parrying and skill management than in the past, and exploring the gorgeous provinces of Sengoku-period Japan is encouraged thanks to the revamped map that deemphasizes collecting icons and checking off lists. Naoe and Yasuke are well-realized and memorable protagonists, even though most of the story they drive follows pretty predictable paths. Both have unique playstyles that bolster each other’s weaknesses, but they are ultimately imbalanced by the fact that you can make use of the stealth and exploration skills of the master shinobi far more than the superhuman strength of the samurai. This isn’t the Assassin’s Creed that will change the minds of folks that never co
title: Assassin's Creed Shadows Review

description:
Join members of the development team on Assassin's Creed Shadows as they discuss their favorite features from the upcoming action RPG, including light and shadow gameplay, dual protagonists, the observe mechanic, dynamic seasons and how they affect gameplay, the characters, and more. Assassin's Creed Shadows will be available on PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X|S, macOS, Amazon Luna, and PC (Steam) on March 20, 2025.

In Assassin’s Creed Shadows, you will live the intertwined stories of Naoe, an adept shinobi Assassin from Iga Province, and Yasuke, the powerful African samurai of historical legend. Against the backdrop of the turbulent late Sengoku period, this remarkable duo will discover their common destiny as they usher in a new era for Japan.
title: Assassin's Creed Shadows - Official Developers' Favorite Features Overview

description:
Chaos, comedy, and combat collide in Brute Horse! Join a fearless barbarian, his trusty steed, and a sharp-witted assassin-inventor on a wild mission to save Horse from an untimely fate in the absurd world of South Vulgaria. Learn about the story of Brute Horse in this latest fun trailer for the upcoming action platformer game. The new Brute Horse trailer also gives us a peek at gameplay and the game's strange world.

Action, adventure, and absurdity await. Brute Horse will be available on PC (Steam), Xbox, and PlayStation. If you're interested, you can wishlist Brute Horse now on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/3034820/Brute_Horse/

author: IGN
description:
The hotly anticipated Half-Life 2 RTX Remix launches its demo today, March 18, on Steam, and IGN spoke with its developers from NVIDIA and Orbifold Studios, to discuss how they reimagined Valve’s 20-year-old masterpiece using Nvidia's RTX Remix tech, and debate the concern from some fans that it negatively impacts the original’s atmosphere.

Does modernising an iconic 2004 FPS with 2025 technology live up to the hype, or does DLSS 4, ray tracing, path tracing, and all the other bells and whistles, just take away from Valve's work within the Source Engine? Let's find out!

Half-Life 2: RTX Remix was captured with our NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5090 PC build.

#HalfLife2 #HalfLife2RTX
title: Half-Life 2: RTX Remix - Nvidia Devs Explain How It Works

author: IGN
description:
Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition reviewed by George Yang on Nintendo Switch.

Xenoblade Chronicles X was already one of the Wii U’s best games, and this Definitive Edition has escaped the destruction of its old home like the White Whale and settled down nicely on Switch. The quality-of-life improvements here are enough to justify another trip to Mira alone for veteran players, and it’s the perfect opportunity for newcomers to explore its beautiful landscapes for themselves. Its combat systems are deep and engaging, and the massive open world never got old to run, jump or fly across. Its main story may not quite live up to the standards of the series, but a likable cast of characters and plenty of compelling side missions mean Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition is still an adventure worth writing back home about.
title: Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition Review

author: IGN
description:
Don't miss the Reveal Trailer for ARK: Lost Colony, a new original expansion pack developed by Studio Wildcard for ARK: Survival Ascended. Players will be greeted with new challenges as the tables turn and embody the hunted in the vast occupied city of Arat Prime. Attain new character abilities, unlock powerful gear, and strive to connect the past and future of ARK as the expansion sets out to link the storylines of ARK’s Extinction and Genesis expansions leading to ARK 2. ARK: Lost Colony is launching in November 2025 for PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X|S, and PC (Steam).

#IGN #Gaming
title: ARK: Lost Colony - Official Reveal Trailer

author: IGN
description:
WWE 2K25 reviewed by Will Borger on PlayStation 5, also available on PC and Xbox Series X|S.

A couple of microtransaction-fueled missteps aside, WWE 2K25 is really the best wrestling game since… WWE 2K24, which was also pretty great. It looks fantastic, still feels good, and there’s a lot of it, including small but welcome updates like intergender matches or bigger updates like the new MyRise and Showcase modes. It’s an upscale wrestling buffet, if you will: It’s pretty scrumptious, there's a wide selection of dishes on the table, and you could spend an awful lot of time in the squared circle if you’re not careful.
title: WWE 2K25 Review

author: IGN
description:
Fort Oasis is no paradise—it's a decaying terrormare where reality crumbles. From the creator of Turbo Overkill comes a survival-horror stacked with mysteries and monstrosities. Scavenge scraps to craft weapons and follow a cryptic voice on your walkie-talkie through the island's depths. Descend into Total Chaos, a gripping terrormare that blurs the line between reality and madness. The demo for Total Chaos is available now!

#IGN #Gaming
title: Total Chaos - Official Gameplay Trailer | The MIX | Kinda Funny Spring Showcase 2025
